They are characterized by their succulent leaves and small, often clustered flowers that may be white, yellow, or red. Pseudaegiphila species are adapted to harsh environments, often growing in rocky soils or on limestone. Their botanical features make them interesting subjects for study in xerophytic plant ecology.
